title: Handbags as LVMH sets up fight for Tiffany
text:
At 70 years old, and with a near-$100bn fortune, you would think French fashion tycoon Bernard Arnault had accumulated all the luxury money can buy. After all, this is a man whose wardrobe is bursting with the world’s finest brands.

As well as the Louis Vuitton, Moët and Hennessy labels that headline his LVMH empire, Europe’s wealthiest man also owns Christian Dior haute couture, Bulgari jewellery, Hublot watches and Veuve Clicquot champagne.

Yet, Arnault is planning his biggest shopping spree so far with a $14.5bn (£11.3bn) takeover of American jeweller Tiffany, best known for its diamond engagement rings and distinctive blue gift boxes.
